website_summaries.verdict: These herb seeds are worth considering if environmental issues are important to you, as the company puts a lot of thought into producing seeds and packaging them with Mother Earth in mind.
pros: An excellent choice for the environment-conscious gardener, as these seeds are non-GMO, organic, and come in compostable packages
Includes 10 popular heirloom culinary herb seeds
Comes with a handy growing guide
cons: Some varieties have been reported not to germinate, though user error may play a role
Occasional incidences of missing seed varieties or packets with few seeds in them

customer_reviews.title: Great Seeds!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my pallet herb garden. I was a bit worried when the instructions said to seed these indoors, but I went agead and planted them in their pots and hung them on the pallet. They are growing beautifully with minimal work on my part! I planted all the varieties, and they have all come up. Rosemary was the last to bloom. There are plenty of seeds in the package (for trial and error). I would recommend to anyone. See my photos!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Rowe

customer_reviews.title: physical therapy for this disabled vet.
customer_reviews.text: Hi. Looking forward to the Zen of a garden. Need to move around and do more activity after the hospital. What can be better. Just trying to set it up so I can use a chair. An added incentive is that living things are dependent on my level of commitment, as was my Malamute, and I get ashamed at not keeping up. (Damn Catholic nuns!) What a guilt trip. All in fun, give a prayer. TX Steve.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Top of line seads.
customer_reviews.text: Package we best I have ever seen. I have been gardening for 72 years. Very good instruction for planting, Soil requirement, and harvesting. Also how to save seeds. Very happy gardener!
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Could be a real lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I got these seeds for my sister for her summer garden. She was really impressed by the variety of seeds and the direction cards. She is planning to plant about ten different types of vegetables this summer. I will harvest the seeds and place them in a brown paper bag for next year. We will save the unused seeds for the future. I was looking for Non-GMO seeds after learning more about the GMO seeds. From now on, this is all we will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Davis

customer_reviews.title: One month in and no germination from any seeds
customer_reviews.text: I planted 6 seeds from each herb seeds. 4 in a “Green house” that was provided for a month and 2 seeds from each seeds in a wet paper towel for 3 weeks, using a heat mat that’s designed for this purpose. To date none of the seeds germinated. I’m throwing all this a way and try a new seeds from a deferent company and see if that work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: and pretty much nothing has sprouted
customer_reviews.text: Have never used this type of growing material - so I actually read the instructions and followed them. The necessary time has passed, and pretty much nothing has sprouted. Some dill seeds did sprout that were planted in the supplied material -- but within days they have keeled over and look dead. I planted the lavendar seeds in traditional seed starter materials - its been three weeks and we've got nothing. I'll add, just so you don't think its me, the tomato seeds from another source that I started in the traditional manner have all sprouted and are doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J. BIggs

customer_reviews.title: However it was a disappointment that the main seed pack I wanted was not ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this three stars because the seeds I received were not what was pictured. I particularly wanted this seed pack because of it coming with Borage. I received it today and there was no Borage instead I received lavender. I am keeping the packet because I don't mind having the lavender. However it was a disappointment that the main seed pack I wanted was not included.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa D

customer_reviews.title: Nope - buy seeds elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I planted these the same time I planted other herbs using the typical seed in peet method. None of them ever grew, while the others I planted are doing phenomenal. The coating on the seeds was too thick, keeping the herbs from proper germination. Highly unsatisfied, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful collection of seeds. Came up with in a week's time. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Leigh Manion

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seeds, terrible coconut thingies
customer_reviews.text: The seeds from this set get five stars. Excellent germination rate, and they are going strong. The coconut pods for starting them? Zero stars. I was skeptical when I saw them, so I started two batches at the same time. Coconut pods as provided in one tray. Peat pods like I normally use in the other. The peat ones all germinated quickly and took off. The coconut ones germinated VERY slowly--WEEKS behind the peat. And struggled and straggled until I finally just put them out in dirt to see if any would make it. The coconut pods are absolute garbage, sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: Ksenya

customer_reviews.title: Few seeds included, not thousands. Good booklet for planting
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product since these were heirloom seeds with good reviews, and what pushed my to buy them was that they claim to come with thousands of seeds. Some of my seed packets only had 15-20 seeds. I have no idea how they claim to have more than a few hundred seeds total, so I feel a little scammed. I only needed a few seeds for a bunch of pots I have, but I was disappointed to run out of seeds so quickly when sowing a small area. I probably would have rated this a five in time after seeing germination, if I had received the proper quantity of product.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performers so far
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these culinary non-GMO seeds from Sustainable Seed. They come with helpful instructions in a sealed bag. Unfortunately, only one of the over 20 seeds I've planted has germinated, and sprouted above ground. The coir planters dried out too quickly, even in my greenhouse. I do want to give these seeds another chance; the reviews and their commitment to the community impresses me. So, I have planted two types of seeds--the non-GMO and another heirloom seed I've had success with in the past. Same potting soil, same container. I will post results and add to my review in a few.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: I've been growing herbs for a long time. This year I decided to try these as they had excellent reviews and a couple of herbs I had not tried before. BIG MISTAKE. As it is still early in the year, I started them in the house so that when the weather changed I could transfer them outdoors. After 4 weeks, only 6 of the seeds have sprouted with only 1 plant (basil) showing good growth. The others that have sprouted are very weak. Not sure why the last 4 didn't sprout. My guess is the coating they put on the seeds is preventing growth. I will never buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Carroll

customer_reviews.title: So far, things are going well.. I ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, things are going well.. I wanted to try seeds given issues I previously had when I bought plants (aphids, gnats...other insect I can't ID). I want my plants to grow indoors so I am setting up indoor lighting appropriate for the plants. Thyme was the first to show up, 100% germination rate on that one. Basil and chives also germinated. Waiting for my cilantro to show up (it is too early to assume it won't germinate). Got really excited about this so I also planted lavender. Too soon to tell as well. Will update later on. Will add pics later as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: There's not twenty-five seeds in each packet that's for sure..
customer_reviews.text: when I got the seed packet I was all excited until I told them open and went to plant them there is only like four or five seeds in each bag not very happy I don't know if they're going to grow yet because I just planted them tonight what's the lavender especially did not have 25 seeds in it lucky if there was five good seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Star wizard man

customer_reviews.title: Germination rate is horrible- DO NOT BUY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Only 5 seeds out of all seeds planted germinated, they were 2 Cilantro, 2 Basil and 1 Parsely. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THESE SEEDS TO ANYONE. Unfortunately, our window for complaints and returns has passed as you have to wait for them to grow (not that we could return attempted sowed seeds). If I could give Zero Stars I would. Extremely unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R

customer_reviews.title: 2nd year ordering these
customer_reviews.text: This is my second year ordering these. Last year everything came up in my seed trays without issue, in fact I was amazed at the fact that every pod in 2 36 pod trays had growth. This year the only thing that has come up is the Dill, that is it. not a single sprout from any other seeds, but all 9 Dill pods sprouted. Not so sure the coating that is on them this year is such a good idea. Now I have to go spend even more money on herb plants at Lowes or Banfield-Baker...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anvoots

customer_reviews.title: Only herbs that grew where was Basil and it died within a week of sprouting.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know what I could have done wrong. It was in a sunny location, out of direct sunlight, never ran dry, but only two herbs of the 10 sprouted and that was basil. But even those withered within the week of sprouting. I will try replanting but I do not feel my batch was a good batch of seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Nothing grew. Nadda. I’m great at growing things. I’ve had these for some time now, doing everything I’m supposed to be growing, and I’ve had nothing grow. I’m so disappointed. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Tami S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad; Lavender and rosemary seeds did not sprout
customer_reviews.text: Not bad; I planted these a month ago using a jiffy tray + peat pellets (and a low heat source), and most things came up pretty fast (5-9 days) --however, the lavender did not sprout at all, and only one of my ~15-20 rosemary seeds sprouted (sage and rosemary are mislabeled in the attached photo).
customer_reviews.author: DoctorJerboa

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, defective seeds
customer_reviews.text: This was a total scam, not one seed sprouted from this while all my homemade boxes with all my veggies sprouted perfectly. I bought this to save a little time now it’s just wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, low yield
customer_reviews.text: I have tried planting these twice. Once outside (30 seeds) with a result of zero seeds sprouting. So I tried again inside under grow lights. The second attempt resulted in 4 of 20 seeds sprouting. I am an experienced gardener and have never seen such poor results in the past. I think the quality of the seed is poor.
customer_reviews.author: nik

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT GERMINATE
customer_reviews.text: I tried two different methods to get these seeds to germinate -- directly into the soil and on a damp paper towel placed in a ziploc bag. Neither method worked -- even putting the seeds under a grow light for warmth. The seller was QUICK to offer a replacement or refund. I would buy from the seller again, but not these seeds. THEY HAVE A PROTECTIVE COATING -- sort of like an M&M. I don't know if that was the problem or not.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Summers

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!  Hardly any seeds.
customer_reviews.text: Only approx 8-15 seeds inside each of these small pouches. Not worth the money. Didn't open and I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: PHAC

customer_reviews.title: I should have read it more clearly....
customer_reviews.text: So this is a pack of seed packets. The seeds are coated and it comes with a cute book for beginners. I use a seed sprouter to make microgreens to consume just after germination. These packets contain a VERY SMALL amount of seeds per pack. So they were useless to me basically as the 11 dollar set filled up 1//4 of my seed sprouter. Although they would work well if you were looking to start a actual herb garden in a small corner of your garden.
customer_reviews.author: Mishka666

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your green thumb!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that come with the package were very detailed and helpful. Generous portion of seeds. I had no problems with getting the seeds to grow, and they germinated significantly faster than expected. Just make sure you read the instructions on how to grow each seed, as some of them need things like being put in the fridge and getting soaked in water. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Poor germination rate
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this seed collection. I have no idea what they coat the seeds with that are suppose to aid in germination but only 1 of every 6 seeds I planted germinated; I am going to try again - but right now I am disappointed. Other seeds I planted at the same time are doing extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Dud seeds
customer_reviews.text: I have a very green thumb and am usually very successful in getting most seeds to grow, however I was unable to get one single seed in this collection to grow, even when I followed the "foolproof" instructions exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These seeds did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: The seeds I planted did not come up. I used the new Organics soil by Miracle Grow. I'm not sure why this has not worked. This is the first time I have used the coated seeds. Going forward, I think I will just stick to the regular seeds with which I have had geat luck over many years.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, from the seller straight to the item. The packaging was amazing, real professional looking, and all information and instructions printed very clearly. I immediately planted them so I am waiting to see how long they actually take to germinate. I will order from this seller again just because I loved the customer service. hehehe. will update this review when my seeds begin to germinate.
customer_reviews.author: Jasyl

customer_reviews.title: Who the hell knows they are seeds yet to be germinated
customer_reviews.text: This is a general message to Amazon asking for reviews I products I have purchased. For example this package of seeds I received it yesterday and today you asked me how I liked it. You might want to give me some time to grow the product before I evaluate it. At this moment in time all I can say about the product is that the package you was very nice
customer_reviews.author: Banks R Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Worse seeds ever
customer_reviews.text: Out of 10 packages of direrent seeds only the sage 4 plants came out. I properly plant then and fallow all instruction also this is not the first time plant herb seeds I do that all the time. Worse seeds ever
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Brannon

customer_reviews.title: 8/10 of seed varieties have germinated
customer_reviews.text: 8/10 seeds have sprouted as of today (roughly 26 days after planting). I’m hopeful that the last two germinate soon, as they did have longer germination ranges noted on the packets. However, every other seed I planted has sprouted successfully and they’re thriving. I’m starting everything indoors early so that I have good starts to transplant into my garden this Spring. I will be using these for culinary purposes. If the other two sprout, I will update my review. Update: every seed has now sprouted! The last two took some time but they are germinating. If I had to guess the germination rate for the last to is about 5-10% at best. But at least some sprouted!
customer_reviews.author: Chefmom

customer_reviews.title: Get these.  You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect selection of herbs. Packaged with informational booklet. Especially like purple basil which I grow and dry every year. Makes amazing spaghetti sauce. So much tastier than store bought dried herbs. I think everyone would be amazed at something like these herbs that even a terrible gardener like me can grow. Also dried chives and full work in so many dishes. You want a great smelling kitchen. Bake bread and cook with herbs you grew you rself. The best!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: None of the seeds sprouted
customer_reviews.text: I first tried following the instructions, and then just tried to get the seeds to sprout in a ziploc bag with a moist paper towel (usually foolproof) and none of them did. All duds, apparently. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: 4Dragons

customer_reviews.title: So Far Basils are at 100% Germination Rate
customer_reviews.text: Planted a few seeds. It's been 4days and basils sprouted all 5 of them. (See the photo taken in the morning light) Other seeds (I tried 7 varieties this week) are buried under the thin layer of soil, so it would take some more days for them to come out. It is promising. I'm looking forward to see more of them, especially the lavender currently undergoing the stratification, to make it. Update: Day 5 and basil seedlings grew so much in just one day! I'm adding the day 5 photo to compare with the original first day 4 photo.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbunny

customer_reviews.title: Sorry to say this was a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: A few seeds came up from 2 packages, the rest did not.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Did not germinate
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions and none of the seeds germinates. I did receive every packet in the kit along with instruction booklet. The seeds were inoculated to get them to grow but after 4 weeks nothing came up. I planted my seeds outdoors in well draining soil and lots of sun and temps between 60-80F. Seeds from another herb kit grew that were also grown in the same grow conditions but in a separate pot. No expiration date on the kit or packets so I don’t know if these were still viable for 2020. I would not buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Rei

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed... I was so excited to try these as they had coated seeds. I tried some in water germination and just sowed some in pure organic garden soil... it's been over a month now... planted them on June 13th.... so far only a few parsley and dill seeds germinated but the seedlings are weak... I dont like this gardening experience at all... these seeds are duds. Not buying again considering these are way overpriced. I had better luck with the seeds I purchased at the dollar store for 2/$1.
customer_reviews.author: Your average reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Will do better just to buy the plants ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing sprouted. I tried in the ground, and in my greenhouses.. Very disappointed. Will do better just to buy the plants at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Karen McHenry

customer_reviews.title: A very fulfilling little collection of herbs
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my wife a couple Christmases ago, in conjunction with a cool little stacking pot herb garden. These went great with the pots and we grew herbs from them that still thrive in our outdoor garden today! She was happy with them pretty much overall. We only had difficulty starting one or two herbsthat we couldn't get to grow.. not sure if that was was due to us or the quality of the seeds. Cool though to be able to buy seeds over the computer and then enjoy the herbs in your food after you grow them!!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Herb Seeds
customer_reviews.text: These folks know their stuff! They have a great selection of seeds. The packaging is minimal (a pet peeve of mine) and the directions are clear. By this time we have planted each of the types of seeds and there is not a dud in the bunch. We purchased a variety pack and have enjoyed the basil and cilantro as well as parsley and thyme. The chives are delicate and thin, unlike my garden variety but they taste so good. We have not used up all the seeds as we grow them in small pots in a hydroponic arrangement. So we have more yummy herbs to look forward to!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Hjortland

customer_reviews.title: followed directions to the >>>T
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed ,I followed directions to the T ,used the soil authorized, bought the best indoor hydroponic garden , for the seeds i bought, I do a great deal of research .to make sure i get the best, the reason for the bad review ,watered like i was to and what happened a few grew then thinned out and dried , i was like what ,only thing that could have gone wrong, the seeds were too old . i will not be buying seeds off line again lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: One technique for all seeds I used -plant all into coconut starters -spray bottle daily once and put in sunlight -put plastic wrap over the top to make greenhouse -planted in planter after 1 week Things that are not as good -seeds that didn’t sprout are likely not ready yet ...
customer_reviews.text: 80% growing after 2 weeks. Didn’t follow all the instructions and still worked. One technique for all seeds I used -plant all into coconut starters -spray bottle daily once and put in sunlight -put plastic wrap over the top to make greenhouse -planted in planter after 1 week Things that are not as good -seeds that didn’t sprout are likely not ready yet as some take longer -birds ate some of my seeds when I put it outside (haha)
customer_reviews.author: sabinanners

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but cant say i was much impressed for the cost. Average purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Good variety, some of the packets seemed to have very few seeds compared to others specifically the lavender. The lavender did not germinate or sprout at all. The booklet says to flash cool and sand the husk.... The seeds are smaller than a pinhead how exactly would one accomplish this? Like seriously if theres a. Method for sanding near microscopic pods if love to see it. The basil is very robust and sprouted easily. The oregano sprouted then wilted but i chalk this to a mild case of mold. The dill is very temperamental by nature to transplanting and wilted, but again not any issue with the seeds that i can see. They germinated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Herb seed package
customer_reviews.text: Just planted seeds in provided medium so cannot comment on germination yet. The cilantro only had 6 seeds in the package, not 25 as specified. Also did not receive the planting guide. May 4 UPDATE: none of the seeds germinated.don't waste you money on this. because i had to wait for to see if the seeds were going to grow i missed the return window. amazon has issued a small compensation for my trouble but "cannot" submit a refund.
customer_reviews.author: grubniffer

customer_reviews.title: Only the Basil grew
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this same set this year and only the basil grew, We purchased this same set last year and everything grew great. Not sure what the problem is as we have been growing herbs for years and this was the first time we had such terrible results. No way to return as the seeds are in the ground and doing nothing except basil. Not sure if we were sent last years stock or what but we were very dissatisfied with this years seeds. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: A total waste of Thyme
customer_reviews.text: First, the little booklet was a nice touch but, after 100+ days I have picked out the unsprouted seeds (easy to spot as they are painted bright greenish-blue) and have repurposed the soil. The photo shows (foreground) 2 tiny sprouts, they died. In the background are tomatoes I planted (from seed) the same week-end in April 2020. That is only one of four planters that didn't sprout. Very disappointing. The seeds spilled from the bird feeder sprouted before these seeds did.
customer_reviews.author: rfguy

customer_reviews.title: Approximately 25 seeds means.... 3?
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package of seeds today, excited to get my hands in the dirt and start my seedlings. The seeds came with a booklet of helpful information for planting and harvesting which was a pleasant suprise. I was all ready to start my herbs and fall in love with my new plant babies, until I opened the package of chives and found only 3 seeds. The seed packet is labeled approximately 25 seeds so I would be forgiving of a standard deviation of 5, but with three seeds they had better have a germination rate of 100%. Please review your packaging practices and ensure that future outgoing products are more consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seeds, everything grew!!
customer_reviews.text: I planted these seeds about 30 days ago in my aero garden--WOW!!! The seeds sprouted and are now healthy plants. the seeds are packaged well and the envelopes are resealable. Most/all of the seeds sprouted, the packaging is premium, I am buying all my spring seeds from this company!
customer_reviews.author: KSB

customer_reviews.title: Sprouts but the coating can be hard to dissolve
customer_reviews.text: So far it sprouts decently, but it appears as if the coating surrounding it either prevents it or slows it down a lot on some of them. I have had to break the coating a few times to get it so the plant started getting what it needed. I'm not sure why the coating didn't dissolve the way it should have but the seeds have had a high rate of growing once I did get it out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: jaylkelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Way to Start
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to get an herb garden started, this is a great way to get going. While it didn't include quite everything I was hoping to get started with on mine, it's a good way to hit most of the big herbs. And the growing guide is going to be very helpful when it comes time for harvest and growing more.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Seeds grew into beautiful healthy plants
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time staring seeds and as I’ve never been able to keep anything alive I didn’t expect good results. I was surprised to see that almost every single seed start was successful. The plants are big now and doing well. I compared the plants grown from these seeds to ones I purchased at the garden center and these ones were much healthier and robust looking. I’ll definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Whiterose

customer_reviews.title: Good seeds. Chuck the pods.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't receive the little greenhouse tray, but that's not a big deal. I planted these seeds in the pods included and only the cilantro grew. Not very well though. Then I planted the seeds in a different type of pod and poof! They are sprouting like crazy. I decided to do a second planting in only potting mix. Again, great results. I would buy this kit for the seeds with no doubt, but I recommend chucking the included planting pods in your compost.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Won't Germinate
customer_reviews.text: Got the product within 12 hours of purchase. Will be planting them later! This is exactly what I was hoping for. :) Update: Didn't have a single seed germinate. It is now approaching 20 days later, and still nothing. I have bought seeds elsewhere and they are already growing healthily, same procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Donley

customer_reviews.title: Planted and all we got out of it is disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I had gifted this to my mother for Christmas and she finally had tried to grow your product using the stuff that was recommended with it. She planted them on March 28 and still nothing has grown from the seeds bought. I'm very disappointed with the results as is my mother. Now I know it's been a while since the purchase but I thought seeds had no expiration date or a date shelf life. I really don't know who to reach out to but I thought this post would help others in selecting a product that wasn't up to standards or faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey G.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing sprouted...do not purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: None of these seeds sprouted, a complete waste of money. When this arrived, I was super excited! I followed the directions and waited. When it came time to plant, I opened one of the grow cores and the seeds were still there, no sprouts, not any activity at all. Had to start over with seeds i purchased locally and planted directly in my garden. Do not waste your time or money on this product!
customer_reviews.author: Shane L.

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as described, but..
customer_reviews.text: the 16 page growing guide was actually, 96 pages, so I guess the descriptions has been updated. So, based on the then description and what I received, that is the "not exactly as described". Seeds are hit or miss sprouting.. I'm adding an herb tank to my hydroponic system.. some of the seeds sprouted right up, others are not.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Meehle

customer_reviews.title: poor germination rate
customer_reviews.text: This product had a lot of potential but I am very disappointed. Very poor germination rate. Out of the entire packet of Basil I got 2 sprouts. 1/2 the pack of rosemary and lavender has yielded zero sprouts. Only thing that has done ok is the dill. I tried both direct sow, and seed starter pods inside. Very disappointed. I believe it is because of the coating. When starting over with new seeds I actually found the fully intact coated seeds in the dirt a month later.
customer_reviews.author: Redpen

customer_reviews.title: Culinary herb collection
customer_reviews.text: Love the information booklet. Tells you how to plant , inside or outside, when and how to harvest and to save seed. Will try and update review after seeds germinate. One week after sprinkling seeds on top of wet jiffy pots and I have basil, rosemary, sage, and thyme seedlings. Lavender seeds are still in the fridge for 2 more weeks before I can plant. The others I will direct sow in March (I live in north Florida) I will try to update again later. So far I am thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN H

customer_reviews.title: Great looking seeds
customer_reviews.text: Just received my seeds and planted. I'm so excited. They all looked so good. I'm a landscaper/ gardner by trade. Great deal and perfect company. Real Seeds!
customer_reviews.author: sherry McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds!
customer_reviews.text: These seeds are fantastic. I have not tried planting all the different varieties yet, but the ones I have planted have grown wonderfully with no problems whatsoever. I love that if I want I can just take a snippet and toss it into a recipe. I've planted the seeds in mason jars and put them in my windowsill so they are a pretty addition besides being useful for cooking. I would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Worst seeds ever! I have tons of experience starting seeds indoors, never had seeds fail to come up like these.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: A big ripoff and very frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. Nothing but the basil came up and then died. When I looked at the seeds after 6 weeks of babying them, they were all still in their hard “coated” shells.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Didn't all germinate and missing instructions
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the aerogarden and for outdoor. Apparently there is an instructions book that should be in the package but mine didn't come with any instructions. In the aerogarden I planted oregano, cilantro, thyme, chives, Rosemary, and Dill. The thyme and rosemary have not sprout. I planted lavender, sage, and more cilantro in soil. Only the cilantro sprout.
customer_reviews.author: Raluca

customer_reviews.title: Missing seeds
customer_reviews.text: Many of the envelopes I received were already open (the glue i guess was not strong enough) and had only one or two seeds in it. The ones I did sow have not come up yet despite proper germination temps, etc. Thinking maybe I received a defective/old batch? Thought it was great otherwise, appreciated the little booklet that came with it and seems like a good company.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Low germination rate
customer_reviews.text: The germination rate was low (20-30% of seedlings that actually succeeded) compared to a variety of non-coated seeds (60-80%) I planted at the same time and into the same soil than these. Some seeds caught mold as soon as the coating cracked, some germinated but the seedlings were never able to get rid of the coating shell and finally died. After 5 weeks, there are still seeds that haven't germinated and that have perfectly uncracked coating even though I've kept the soil moist and warm the whole time (I'm wondering if I should collect them, immerse them into water for a day or so, and try again). Perhaps I just don't know how to deal with coated seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Tada

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and hearty germination!
customer_reviews.text: These seeds germinated very quickly and they were very hearty. The plugs were a good starter material, but they are bit fussy in that they CAN be over watered so be cautious. they were very easy to transplant into soil medium later after a good two weeks under grow light. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michababy1

customer_reviews.title: Chives missing
customer_reviews.text: Edit: 5 stars. Quickly sent chives Original: Seeds are good and are growing quickly. Definitely fresh, and I like the coating for smaller seeds. Cilantro seeds got kinda crushed, but I blame shipping for that. 2 stars because chive was missing, but I’ll update to a higher review if I get replacements. Would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice packaging, good instructions but low germination
customer_reviews.text: The seeds are well packed and contain good instructions. However, I experienced a low termination rate. I only had one basil seed, one sage, a few parsley seeds, a few dill seeds and a few coriander seeds sprout. It’s possible I was doing something wrong, it could also just be nature’s doing, where not all seeds germinate.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Better off picking some up at your local seed and feed.
customer_reviews.text: The basil sprouted within 3 days. Which is pretty normal when I plant basil. But then it was incredibly slow to grow and produced these weird malformed leaves. After two months the sprouts were only an inch or so high and had misshapen leaves. I bought a pack of Ferry Morse seeds at Walmart and planted them in the exact same soil and they shot up without any problems. Clearly these are bad seeds. The oregano barely sprouted and then withered away. The rosemary didn't even think about sprouting. After that I just gave up. All these seeds are duds. And only 20-25 per pack. Just go to your local store and get some. It'll be way cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nearly nothing germinated
customer_reviews.text: Find another pack of seeds. Planted 1/2 of each packet/variety, thinking later plant the rest for herbs into the fall. Have very..VERY few sprouts which took forever to show up. Followed any package directions carefully. After four weeks, I still have only weak, teeny-weeny little sprouts. The options to select stars for this review asks for me to rate the flavor...more than likely I will never know. I have been gardening for years and have grown many things from seed.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: USA company employing Veterans, troubled youth, 2nd chance and disabled.
customer_reviews.text: Not only that, but the seed packets came in a resealabe pouch and with a pamphlet of the best growing instructions I've ever seen. You don't have to use all the seeds at once. The claim is you can store them in the Mylar pouch for future planting up to 5-7 years. I will have to try this. I will amend this as the seeds grow. So far, the only thing I see wrong is the "96 page booklet." There is a 16 page pamphlet, no 96 page booklet.
customer_reviews.author: Manutter

customer_reviews.title: Mostly duds
customer_reviews.text: I had really really bad rates of germination with just about all the varieties in the pack I got. Followed all the directions and seeds from other sources had no trouble at all, but these just didn't go. Think I have 1 little dill sprout hanging on for life and that's all that made it.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Na
customer_reviews.text: Been planted over a month some coming up others nothing
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nealy

customer_reviews.title: Poor or no germination.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the coatings they put on the seeds inhibit germination, or if the seeds are just not viable, but I had little success with this seed company. It certainly not me and my methods, because I then bought of the same plant seeds from David's Garden Seeds, and had 100% germination, and within days.
customer_reviews.author: shark22bv

customer_reviews.title: These aren’t that great
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it is the soil or the seeds but I can’t get any of these herbs to grow and thrive. A few may still germinate but the ones that have emerged do not thrive and end up withering. Very disappointing. I don’t think it’s me - I have planted a total of 110 various types of seedlings this year and this seems to be the only tray that isn’t growing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Herbs
customer_reviews.text: I know some herbs can be slow and hard to start. Thyme came up, as did parsley and chives. Still waiting on Rosemary and Lavender. I know some people like the coated seeds to supposedly make it easier to plant. I think it just makes it harder for the seeds to germinate. The package is nice, the variety is good. Next time I would choose un-coated seeds.
customer_reviews.author: RLMD

customer_reviews.title: Did not grow.
customer_reviews.text: Tried every kind of seed in the group and couldn't get but just a few seeds to sprout.
customer_reviews.author: F. Huston

customer_reviews.title: Flourishing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good variety, everything I planted from this package is coming up beautifully. Seed packets are proper paper envelopes within the mylar bag and good quantities within the envelopes unlike some other bug out packages I have tried. Very happy with both this and the veggie assortment I purchased from the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Garbage seeds : Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Mostly a water of money: of all the herbs, only TWO grew and didn't die right away - basil and parsley. The rest of the seeds were complete GARBAGE and either never sprouted - the rosemary and lavender - or sprouted a small, sad plant quickly before withering away and dying after a week or two. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little kit. The book was a nice surprise. I planted some of each herb 3 weeks ago and everything is growing nicely except the lavender, which is probably my fault for not following the instructions and just putting it straight in the dirt. Overall very impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: clpolaszek

customer_reviews.title: Only one of the seeds sprouted.
customer_reviews.text: I planted some of every variety of the seeds in the kit. One of them sprouted. That one still does not look strong. I planted seeds I bought elsewhere in the extra planters. All of them sprouted quickly. They look strong and healthy! I believe the seeds from the kit are not any good!
customer_reviews.author: gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Planting for fun!
customer_reviews.text: The seeds arrived as expected (actually a day early). They were well packaged and complete as advertised. Looking forward to starting some fall seeds in my small greenhouse. So far very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: kdanibo

customer_reviews.title: More herbs for my garden
customer_reviews.text: Thanks so much for the litlle book with instructions. I have tried the basil (which was my main goal as I could not get seeds here in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic at the time). The plants were beautiful and I cooked a lot with them. Also I could grow the parsely and the oregano (I already had home but not this type). I tryed with the coriander but the seedlings were forgotten and not transplanted on time (oups). Have yet to try the other herbs but still I'm a satisficed client.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Very Excited to Plant!
customer_reviews.text: Received all 10 different seeds and a Herb Planting Guide book. This book explains what each herb is, how/when to grow that seed, the best way to harvest, and how to harvest the seeds from the flowers of the herb after the plant has lived its life. cycle. Additionally, it provides unique recipes for some of the herbs! Very informational and helpful for any beginner like myself! Will definitely be buying my seeds from 'Sustainable Seeds' again!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: No germination
customer_reviews.text: Wish the seeds would germinate. Not a one has germinated even following the package directions. Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as seller makes it sound
customer_reviews.text: Majority of my plants didn't grow; out of 30 i got 8 plants of which 6 were basil. I don't think these seeds are as high quality as the seller suggests.
customer_reviews.author: Sejal

customer_reviews.title: look elsewhere!!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews have said, the ONLY seeds that sprouted were the Basil seeds. Not sure what this companies business model is but, they won't get another penny from me. Don't know why their name is sustainable seeds. You would starve if you counted on these seeds to sustain you. Terrible seeds. DO NOT BUY! Run away, run away!
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Not one of these seeds grew into seedlings.....I had right next to seeds from another source that did sprout and grow. They were a bust.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Manion

customer_reviews.title: Germination guaranteed and now growing nicely
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seeds, came with a very informative booklet with germination and care instructions. I planted 8/10 and they all germinated without fuss. I was thrilled with how little seeds I used to be able to get seedlings. I germinated with rockwool then put the seedlings into hydro cups with hydroton into a homemade hydroponic system with ball wide mouth pint jars. I put them under grow lights and they are all flourishing.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING grew
customer_reviews.text: I have been around the block with herb gardens. I know herbs. I grow herbs. I planted these seeds. Absolutely NOTHING came up. It was astounding. I would attach a photo, but who wants to see a sad bare raised bed with a couple leaves from last fall?
customer_reviews.author: L. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: From seed to sprouts to fresh herbs
customer_reviews.text: Out of all of them, my chives and lavender did not grow, so I took one star off for that. The others are really starting to take off and I'm really proud I was able to grow fresh herbs from seeds. I did use a child's grow light to help get them started, and then planted them in different coffee cans when they were big enough. The rosemary still has the longest to go, followed by the sage, but the rest are flourishing. I am looking forward to using them in my cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Tats76

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage, old and dead seeds. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: This product is an absolute joke. 5% of the seeds have germinated and the rest are still doing.. NOTHING. (As in sitting under the ground covered in that artificial hard shell they came in). The seeds are probably 10+ years old and this company should be barred from selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not one single seed germinated.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing. Nada. I tried all the seeds from all the packages. Stuck in the same soil, under the same conditions as other seeds and plants. Only the seeds from this package, ALL OF THEM, failed to produce a single sprout. When I applied light pressure to one of the "seeds" it literally turned into dust under my finger. Deeply disappointed and suspicious.
customer_reviews.author: lite nerd

customer_reviews.title: ( I really liked the little book that came with the seeds and ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried cilantro, parsley, basil and chives. All sprouted well, basil and parsley are still going strong and I had two harvests already. Chives are taking sometime, but it's one been only a few weeks. Cilantro died due to me overwatering it I think, it grew mold :( I really liked the little book that came with the seeds and explanation for seeding, etc. I will definitely try more packets.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ga

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. The seeds do not germinate well
customer_reviews.text: I planted these seeds in one garden box and seeds purchased from home depot in another, and every seed from home depot has germinated to the point where I cannot count how many plants have sprouted. Meanwhile, my other garden box with these seeds is barren with less than 6 plants sprouted.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Eight weeks after receiving seeds we have wonderful herbs! Aromatic, tasty. Great value. I'll buy again!
customer_reviews.author: PEACENIK

customer_reviews.title: Majority Seeds didn't Sprout
customer_reviews.text: This seed kit is convenient in that has a great variety of herbs I really wanted to grow and that I utilize frequently, versus buying them individually like I normally do. The packaging is great, with a whole lot of information on seedling and plant care. However, only the basil and cilantro sprouted out of the parsley, rosemary, oregano, cilantro, and basil that I first started off with. Super dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: RITIKA

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Germinate
customer_reviews.text: Several of the seed packets would not germinate and or did not grow at the rate of other seeds planted right next to them. Plants were small and never matured.
customer_reviews.author: CAG

product_meta.title: 10 Variety Culinary Herb Collection and 96 Page Growing Guide - Non GMO Heirloom Basil, Thyme, Rosemary, Oregano, Parsley, Lavender, Sage, Cilantro, Chives, Dill
feature_bullets: 10 of the most POPULAR GOURMET herbs: Basil, Chives, Cilantro, Dill, Lavender, Oregano, Parsley, Rosemary, Sage, and Thyme. An instant HERB garden in one pkg. It's easy AND you get a 96 Pg full COLOR Growing Guide

Fresh, JUST HARVESTED 2019 herb seed stock with germination rates that exceed Federal minimums. From Sustainable Seed, a trusted USDA Certified Organic seed company owned and operated right here in the USA

Each eco-friendly, compostable herb seed packet includes detailed planting instructions, all sealed in a waterproof, resealable Mylar package PLUS, our professional MASTER GARDENERS who have been featured in the LA/NY TIMES and WALL STREET JOURNAL; are here to answer any questions you might have. Stop by our 13,000' facility FOR A VISIT We are here to help you GROW

From a real LICENSED seed company. Real paper seed packets with an expiration date, lot number and germination number AS REQUIRED by Federal Seed Law. There is a reason seed companies have been using paper packets for over 200 years. Seed are living organisms that need to breathe. And these packets actually have planting instructions
Warranty | We strive to provide the highest quality plants delivered. 30-day Health Guarantee. If plants arrive damaged or unhealthy, we will issue a full refund or replace your plant.
